info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central McDowell, northeastern Buncombe and southern Yancey Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 449 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Downtown Asheville, or near B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Black Mountain, Swannanoa, B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens, Mount Mitchell State Park, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Warren Wilson College, Montreat and Barnardsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
